review.title: Building a Pilot Software Quality-in-Use Benchmark Dataset
review.abstract: Prepared domain specific datasets plays an important role to supervised learning approaches. In this article a new sentence dataset for software quality-in-use is proposed. Three experts were chosen to annotate the data using a proposed annotation scheme. Then the data were reconciled in a (no match eliminate) process to reduce bias. The Kappa, k statistics revealed an acceptable level of agreement; moderate to substantial agreement between the experts. The built data can be used to evaluate software quality-in-use models in sentiment analysis models. Moreover, the annotation scheme can be used to extend the current dataset.
histories: 6 pages,3 figures, conference Proceedings of 9th International Conference on IT in Asia CITA (2015)
review.COMMENTS: 6 pages,3 figures, conference Proceedings of 9th International Conference on IT in Asia CITA (2015)

Many of them are grammatically incorrect, they cover poor to rich semantic over different sentences, and they convey the user language that does not comply with the ISO standard definition of QinU[11].

An initial approach was proposed in [15] to extract topics from the google documents.
They proposed to use LDA on documents returned by Google Search Engine by searching keywords from the ISO 25010:2010 document [11] .
For example, it is uncommon to find the Keyword “effective”, “efficiency”, or “risk” directly in software reviews that were reported in [11].
Furthermore, results from LSA topic modeling in [16] which is based on general semantics showed bad performance.
They were requested to do the job with a careful understanding of the definitions of QinU characteristics from the ISO document [11].
EXPERTS AGREEMENT To justify the validity of the resultant data set, the Kappa ( ) agreement[17] is used.
The Kappa measures the degree of agreement known as (interannotator agreement) between annotators [18].
According to the guidelines of [19], the agreement is between moderate to substantial agreement.

metadata.abstractText: Prepared domain specific datasets plays an important role to supervised learning approaches. In this article a new sentence dataset for software qualityin-use is proposed. Three experts were chosen to annotate the data using a proposed annotation scheme. Then the data were reconciled in a (no match eliminate) process to reduce bias. The Kappa, statistics revealed an acceptable level of agreement; moderate to substantial agreement between the experts. The built data can be used to evaluate software quality-in-use models in sentiment analysis models. Moreover, the annotation scheme can be used to extend the current dataset. Keywords—Quality in use, Benchmark dataset, software quality, sentiment analysis
